newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil trims losses but market remains sickly.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil trims losses but market remains sickly.

text.p: NWE gas oil eased off Tuesday's closing lows on Wednesday as benchmark futures pared losses but traders said prices looked set to remain sickly in ample supply.
June gas oil futures closed $1.00 higher at $173.00 a tonne, having shed $5.75 on Tuesday.
Heating oil barges traded at June IPE +$1.25 and +$1.50 fob ARA for storage material and +$1.75 fob Rotterdam.
Traders said the market was fairly quiet ahead of the Corpus Christi public holiday in parts of Germany.
A Russian cargo traded at June IPE +$1.50 cif NWE for flexible delivery. Traders said the seller had a 21,000 and a 27,000 tonne cargo on the water and the buyer had the option to take either one.
"There's a lot of stuff around at the moment and the collapse in prices in the Med isn't really helping the situation," one player said.
At least three Med cargoes of diesel spec material were believed to on their way to Northwest Europe. Traders said the cargoes would likely go into the owners' systems.
